title: Early Settlements
description: Archaeological evidence shows Neolithic settlements at Chirand (Saran district). Painted Grey Ware culture flourished in the region.

title: Emergence of Janapadas
description: Bihar region mentioned in Rigveda as 'Kikata'. Emergence of important janapadas like Videha (Mithila) and Magadha.
sources: Bihar Through the Ages by K.K. Datta

title: Rise of Magadha Empire
description: Bimbisara established the first Magadhan capital at Rajgir. Ajatashatru built the fort at Pataliputra. First Buddhist Council held at Rajgir.

title: Golden Age of Bihar
description: Chandragupta Maurya established India's first empire with Pataliputra as capital. Ashoka spread Buddhism after Kalinga war. Built pillars and stupas across Bihar.

title: Classical Renaissance
description: Pataliputra became center of learning. Aryabhata made astronomical discoveries. Nalanda University founded during this period.

title: Buddhist Revival
description: Dharma Pala made Bihar the center of Buddhist learning. Vikramshila University established. Tibetan pilgrims visited Bihar's monasteries.

title: Islamic Rule Begins
description: Bakhtiyar Khilji destroyed Nalanda and Vikramshila. Bihar became part of Bengal province. Sufi saints established khanqahs.
sources: Bihar in Delhi Sultanate by Qeyamuddin Ahmad

title: Sher Shah Suri's Reforms
description: Sher Shah (from Sasaram) introduced Rupee currency and Grand Trunk Road. Patna became important trading center. Maner became Sufi center.

title: Colonial Exploitation
description: Battle of Buxar (1764) gave British control. Indigo cultivation led to Champaran Satyagraha (1917). Bihar separated from Bengal in 1912.

title: Modern Bihar
description: Land reforms under K.B. Sahay. Creation of Jharkhand in 2000. Recent infrastructure development including bridges over Ganga and education reforms.
